surface_layer.definition: A theory of phonation that explains how vocal fold oscillations are self-sustained.

deep_layer.mechanism: Vocal fold oscillations are self-sustained due to increased subglottal pressure, airflow through the glottis, and elastic recoil of vocal fold muscles.
deep_layer.origin: Formulated by van den Berg in the late 1950s.

epistemic_metadata.source: Integrative Insights into the Myoelastic-Aerodynamic Theory and ..., Myoelastic Aerodynamic Theory and Vocal Rehabilitation (part 1)
citations: Integrative Insights into the Myoelastic-Aerodynamic Theory and ...
